theorem: ∀ {R : Type u} [inst : Ring R], IsField R
fullPrompt:
[{"role": "system",
  "content":
  "You are a coding assistant who translates from natural language to Lean Theorem Prover code following examples. Follow EXACTLY the examples given."},
 {"role": "user",
  "content":
  "Any conditionally complete linearly ordered field is archimedean. "},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content":
  "∀ {α : Type u_1} [inst : ConditionallyCompleteLinearOrderedField α], Archimedean α"},
 {"role": "user",
  "content":
  "If two rings are isomorphic, and the second is a domain, then so is the first. "},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content":
  "∀ {A : Type u_1} (B : Type u_2) [inst : Ring A] [inst_1 : Ring B] [inst_2 : IsDomain B], A ≃+* B → IsDomain A"},
 {"role": "user", "content": "A field extension is integral if it is finite. "},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content":
  "∀ (K : Type u_1) (L : Type u_2) [inst : Field K] [inst_1 : Field L] [inst_2 : Algebra K L]\n  [inst_3 : FiniteDimensional K L], Algebra.IsIntegral K L"},
 {"role": "user",
  "content": "All ideals in a division (semi)ring are trivial. "},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content":
  "∀ {K : Type u} [inst : DivisionSemiring K] (I : Ideal K), I = ⊥ ∨ I = ⊤"},
 {"role": "user", "content": "A finite field has prime power cardinality. "},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content":
  "∀ {α : Type u_1} [inst : Fintype α] [inst_1 : Field α], IsPrimePow (Fintype.card α)"},
 {"role": "user", "content": "A subring contains the ring's 0. "},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content": "∀ {R : Type u} [inst : Ring R] (s : Subring R), 0 ∈ s"},
 {"role": "user",
  "content": "The characteristic of a finite ring cannot be zero. "},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content":
  "∀ (R : Type u_1) [inst : NonAssocRing R] (p : ℕ) [inst : CharP R p] [inst : Finite R], p ≠ 0"},
 {"role": "user",
  "content": "Stalks of a locally ringed space are local rings. "},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content":
  "∀ (self : AlgebraicGeometry.LocallyRingedSpace) (x : ↑↑self.toPresheafedSpace),\n  LocalRing ↑(TopCat.Presheaf.stalk self.presheaf x)"},
 {"role": "user",
  "content":
  "The quotient of a ring by an ideal is a field iff the ideal is maximal. "},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content":
  "∀ {R : Type u} [inst : CommRing R] (I : Ideal R), Ideal.IsMaximal I ↔ IsField (R ⧸ I)"},
 {"role": "user", "content": "The category of rings has all limits. "},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content":
  "CategoryTheory.Limits.HasLimitsOfSize.{v, v, max u v, max (u + 1) (v + 1)} CommSemiRingCatMax"},
 {"role": "user", "content": "Every ring involution must be its own inverse "},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content":
  "∀ {F : Type u_1} {R : outParam (Type u_2)} [inst : Semiring R] [self : RingInvoClass F R] (f : F) (x : R),\n  MulOpposite.unop (↑f (MulOpposite.unop (↑f x))) = x"},
 {"role": "user",
  "content": "Any infinite type can be endowed a field structure. "},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content": "∀ {α : Type u} [inst : Infinite α], Nonempty (Field α)"},
 {"role": "user",
  "content":
  "For a semiring to be a field, it must have two distinct elements. "},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content": "∀ {R : Type u} [inst : Semiring R], IsField R → ∃ x y, x ≠ y"},
 {"role": "user",
  "content": "When a ring is not a field, the maximal ideals are nontrivial. "},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content":
  "∀ {R : Type u_1} [inst : CommSemiring R] [inst_1 : Nontrivial R] {M : Ideal R}, Ideal.IsMaximal M → ¬IsField R → M ≠ ⊥"},
 {"role": "user",
  "content": "A linear ordered field that is a floor ring is archimedean. "},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content":
  "∀ (α : Type u_1) [inst : LinearOrderedField α] [inst_1 : FloorRing α], Archimedean α"},
 {"role": "user", "content": "Fields are commutative. "},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content":
  "∀ {R : Type u} [inst : Semiring R], IsField R → ∀ (x y : R), x * y = y * x"},
 {"role": "user",
  "content": "The ring of integers of a number field is not a field. "},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content":
  "∀ (K : Type u_1) [inst : Field K] [nf : NumberField K], ¬IsField { x // x ∈ NumberField.ringOfIntegers K }"},
 {"role": "user", "content": "An intermediate field contains the ring's 1. "},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content":
  "∀ {K : Type u_2} {L : Type u_1} [inst : Field K] [inst_1 : Field L] [inst_2 : Algebra K L] (S : IntermediateField K L),\n  1 ∈ S"},
 {"role": "user", "content": "An intermediate field contains the ring's 0. "},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content":
  "∀ {K : Type u_2} {L : Type u_1} [inst : Field K] [inst_1 : Field L] [inst_2 : Algebra K L] (S : IntermediateField K L),\n  0 ∈ S"},
 {"role": "user", "content": "A field is a valuation ring. "},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content": "∀ (K : Type u) [inst : Field K], ValuationRing K"},
 {"role": "user", "content": "Every ring is a field."}]
all_elaborations: ¬∀ (R : Type u) [inst : Ring R], IsField R
∀ {R : Type u} [inst : Ring R], IsField R
∀ (R : Type u) [inst : Ring R], IsField R
∀ {R : Type u} [inst : CommRing R], IsField R

theorem: ∀ {G : Type u_1} [inst : Group G], Monoid.IsTorsion G
text: Every group is a torsion monoid.
fullPrompt:
[{"role": "system",
  "content":
  "You are a coding assistant who translates from natural language to Lean Theorem Prover code following examples. Follow EXACTLY the examples given."},
 {"role": "user",
  "content":
  "Quotienting a group by its additive torsion subgroup yields an additive torsion free group."},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content":
  "∀ (G : Type u_1) [inst : AddCommGroup G], AddMonoid.IsTorsionFree (G ⧸ AddCommGroup.torsion G)"},
 {"role": "user",
  "content":
  "Direct products of additive torsion free groups are torsion free."},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content":
  "∀ {η : Type u_1} {Gs : η → Type u_2} [inst : (i : η) → AddGroup (Gs i)],\n  (∀ (i : η), AddMonoid.IsTorsionFree (Gs i)) → AddMonoid.IsTorsionFree ((i : η) → Gs i)"},
 {"role": "user",
  "content":
  "The additive torsion submonoid of an abelian group equals the torsion\nsubgroup as a submonoid."},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content":
  "∀ (G : Type u_1) [inst : AddCommGroup G], AddCommMonoid.addTorsion G = (AddCommGroup.torsion G).toAddSubmonoid"},
 {"role": "user",
  "content":
  "The image of a surjective torsion group homomorphism is torsion. "},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content":
  "∀ {G : Type u_1} {H : Type u_2} [inst : Group G] [inst_1 : Group H] {f : G →* H},\n  Function.Surjective ↑f → Monoid.IsTorsion G → Monoid.IsTorsion H"},
 {"role": "user", "content": "Torsion monoids are really groups. "},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content":
  "{G : Type u_1} → [inst : Monoid G] → Monoid.IsTorsion G → Group G"},
 {"role": "user",
  "content": "Additive torsion groups are closed under extensions."},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content":
  "∀ {G : Type u_1} {H : Type u_2} [inst : AddGroup G] {N : AddSubgroup G} [inst_1 : AddGroup H] {f : G →+ H},\n  N = AddMonoidHom.ker f → AddMonoid.IsTorsion H → AddMonoid.IsTorsion { x // x ∈ N } → AddMonoid.IsTorsion G"},
 {"role": "user",
  "content": "If a group exponent exists, the group is torsion. "},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content":
  "∀ {G : Type u_1} [inst : Group G], Monoid.ExponentExists G → Monoid.IsTorsion G"},
 {"role": "user",
  "content": "Direct products of torsion free groups are torsion free. "},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content":
  "∀ {η : Type u_1} {Gs : η → Type u_2} [inst : (i : η) → Group (Gs i)],\n  (∀ (i : η), Monoid.IsTorsionFree (Gs i)) → Monoid.IsTorsionFree ((i : η) → Gs i)"},
 {"role": "user",
  "content": "Additive torsion submonoids are additively torsion."},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content":
  "∀ {G : Type u_1} [inst : AddCommMonoid G], AddMonoid.IsTorsion { x // x ∈ AddCommMonoid.addTorsion G }"},
 {"role": "user",
  "content":
  "Quotienting a group by its torsion subgroup yields a torsion free group. "},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content":
  "∀ (G : Type u_1) [inst : CommGroup G], Monoid.IsTorsionFree (G ⧸ CommGroup.torsion G)"},
 {"role": "user",
  "content": "The torsion submonoid of a torsion monoid is `⊤`. "},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content":
  "∀ {G : Type u_1} [inst : CommMonoid G], Monoid.IsTorsion G → CommMonoid.torsion G = ⊤"},
 {"role": "user",
  "content":
  "The torsion submonoid of an abelian group equals the torsion subgroup as a submonoid. "},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content":
  "∀ (G : Type u_1) [inst : CommGroup G], CommMonoid.torsion G = (CommGroup.torsion G).toSubmonoid"},
 {"role": "user", "content": "Torsion groups are closed under extensions. "},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content":
  "∀ {G : Type u_1} {H : Type u_2} [inst : Group G] {N : Subgroup G} [inst_1 : Group H] {f : G →* H},\n  N = MonoidHom.ker f → Monoid.IsTorsion H → Monoid.IsTorsion { x // x ∈ N } → Monoid.IsTorsion G"},
 {"role": "user",
  "content": "Finite additive groups are additive torsion groups."},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content":
  "∀ {G : Type u_1} [inst : AddGroup G] [inst_1 : Finite G], AddMonoid.IsTorsion G"},
 {"role": "user",
  "content":
  "Subgroups of additive torsion-free groups are additively torsion-free."},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content":
  "∀ {G : Type u_1} [inst : AddGroup G],\n  AddMonoid.IsTorsionFree G → ∀ (H : AddSubgroup G), AddMonoid.IsTorsionFree { x // x ∈ H }"},
 {"role": "user", "content": "Torsion submonoids are torsion. "},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content":
  "∀ {G : Type u_1} [inst : CommMonoid G], Monoid.IsTorsion { x // x ∈ CommMonoid.torsion G }"},
 {"role": "user",
  "content": "Subgroups of torsion-free groups are torsion-free. "},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content":
  "∀ {G : Type u_1} [inst : Group G], Monoid.IsTorsionFree G → ∀ (H : Subgroup G), Monoid.IsTorsionFree { x // x ∈ H }"},
 {"role": "user",
  "content":
  "Subgroups of additive torsion groups are additive torsion groups."},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content":
  "∀ {G : Type u_1} [inst : AddGroup G], AddMonoid.IsTorsion G → ∀ (H : AddSubgroup G), AddMonoid.IsTorsion { x // x ∈ H }"},
 {"role": "user", "content": "Finite groups are torsion groups. "},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content":
  "∀ {G : Type u_1} [inst : Group G] [inst_1 : Finite G], Monoid.IsTorsion G"},
 {"role": "user",
  "content": "Subgroups of torsion groups are torsion groups. "},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content":
  "∀ {G : Type u_1} [inst : Group G], Monoid.IsTorsion G → ∀ (H : Subgroup G), Monoid.IsTorsion { x // x ∈ H }"},
 {"role": "user", "content": "Every group is a torsion monoid."}]
all_elaborations: ∀ {G : Type u_1} [inst : Group G], Monoid.IsTorsion G
∀ (G : Type u_1) [inst : Group G], Monoid.IsTorsion G

theorem: ∀ {α : Type u} [inst : Group α] [inst_1 : Fintype α], IsSimpleGroup α → Fact (Nat.Prime (Fintype.card α))
text: Every finite simple group has prime order.
fullPrompt:
[{"role": "system",
  "content":
  "You are a coding assistant who translates from natural language to Lean Theorem Prover code following examples. Follow EXACTLY the examples given."},
 {"role": "user",
  "content":
  "If a product lies in the prime ideal, then at least one element lies in the prime ideal. "},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content":
  "∀ {α : Type u} [inst : Semiring α] {I : Ideal α} [self : Ideal.IsPrime I] {x y : α}, x * y ∈ I → x ∈ I ∨ y ∈ I"},
 {"role": "user",
  "content": "Every nonzero natural number has a unique prime factorization "},
 {"role": "assistant", "content": "Set.InjOn Nat.factorization {x | x ≠ 0}"},
 {"role": "user", "content": "Finite groups are torsion groups. "},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content":
  "∀ {G : Type u_1} [inst : Group G] [inst_1 : Finite G], Monoid.IsTorsion G"},
 {"role": "user",
  "content": "Every nonzero element of a group with zero is invertible. "},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content":
  "∀ {α : Type u_1} [self : LinearOrderedCommGroupWithZero α] (a : α), a ≠ 0 → a * a⁻¹ = 1"},
 {"role": "user", "content": "A minimal polynomial is prime. "},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content":
  "∀ {A : Type u_1} {B : Type u_2} [inst : Field A] [inst_1 : Ring B] [inst_2 : IsDomain B] [inst_3 : Algebra A B] {x : B},\n  IsIntegral A x → Prime (minpoly A x)"},
 {"role": "user",
  "content":
  "Inverses of elements of finite additive order have finite additive order."},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content":
  "∀ {G : Type u_1} [inst : AddGroup G] {x : G}, IsOfFinAddOrder x → IsOfFinAddOrder (-x)"},
 {"role": "user",
  "content": "The image of an element of finite order has finite order. "},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content":
  "∀ {G : Type u_2} {H : Type u_1} [inst : Monoid G] [inst_1 : Monoid H] (f : G →* H) {x : G},\n  IsOfFinOrder x → IsOfFinOrder (↑f x)"},
 {"role": "user",
  "content": "finite p-groups with different p have coprime orders "},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content":
  "∀ {G : Type u_2} [inst : Group G] {G₂ : Type u_1} [inst_1 : Group G₂] (p₁ p₂ : ℕ) [hp₁ : Fact (Nat.Prime p₁)]\n  [hp₂ : Fact (Nat.Prime p₂)],\n  p₁ ≠ p₂ →\n    ∀ (H₁ : Subgroup G) (H₂ : Subgroup G₂) [inst_2 : Fintype { x // x ∈ H₁ }] [inst_3 : Fintype { x // x ∈ H₂ }],\n      IsPGroup p₁ { x // x ∈ H₁ } →\n        IsPGroup p₂ { x // x ∈ H₂ } → Nat.coprime (Fintype.card { x // x ∈ H₁ }) (Fintype.card { x // x ∈ H₂ })"},
 {"role": "user",
  "content":
  "A group element has finite additive order iff its order is positive."},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content":
  "∀ {G : Type u_1} [inst : AddMonoid G] {x : G}, 0 < addOrderOf x ↔ IsOfFinAddOrder x"},
 {"role": "user", "content": "Any finitely generated ideal is principal. "},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content":
  "∀ {R : Type u} [inst : CommRing R] [self : IsBezout R] (I : Ideal R), Ideal.FG I → Submodule.IsPrincipal I"},
 {"role": "user",
  "content": "A group element has finite order iff its order is positive. "},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content":
  "∀ {G : Type u_1} [inst : Monoid G] {x : G}, 0 < orderOf x ↔ IsOfFinOrder x"},
 {"role": "user",
  "content": "Inverses of elements of finite order have finite order. "},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content":
  "∀ {G : Type u_1} [inst : Group G] {x : G}, IsOfFinOrder x⁻¹ ↔ IsOfFinOrder x"},
 {"role": "user", "content": "A finite field has prime power cardinality. "},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content":
  "∀ {α : Type u_1} [inst : Fintype α] [inst_1 : Field α], IsPrimePow (Fintype.card α)"},
 {"role": "user", "content": "A finite group of prime order is cyclic. "},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content":
  "∀ {α : Type u} [inst : Group α] [inst_1 : Fintype α] {p : ℕ} [hp : Fact (Nat.Prime p)], Fintype.card α = p → IsCyclic α"},
 {"role": "user", "content": "A finite group of prime order is cyclic."},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content":
  "∀ {α : Type u} [inst : AddGroup α] [inst_1 : Fintype α] {p : ℕ} [hp : Fact (Nat.Prime p)],\n  Fintype.card α = p → IsAddCyclic α"},
 {"role": "user", "content": "A finite group of prime order is simple. "},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content":
  "∀ {α : Type u} [inst : Group α] [inst_1 : Fintype α] {p : ℕ} [hp : Fact (Nat.Prime p)],\n  Fintype.card α = p → IsSimpleGroup α"},
 {"role": "user", "content": "A finite group of prime order is simple."},
 {"role": "assistant",
  "content":
  "∀ {α : Type u} [inst : AddGroup α] [inst_1 : Fintype α] {p : ℕ} [hp : Fact (Nat.Prime p)],\n  Fintype.card α = p → IsSimpleAddGroup α"},
 {"role": "user", "content": "Every finite simple group has prime order."}]
all_elaborations:
∀ {α : Type u} [inst : Group α] [inst_1 : Fintype α],
  IsSimpleGroup α → Fact (Nat.Prime (Fintype.card α))
∀ {α : Type u} [inst : Group α] [inst_1 : Fintype α], IsSimpleGroup α → ∃ (p : ℕ), Nat.Prime p ∧ Fintype.card α = p
∀ {G : Type u} [inst : Group G] [inst_1 : Fintype G], IsSimpleGroup G → ∃ (p : ℕ), Fact (Nat.Prime p) ∧ Fintype.card G = p
∀ {α : Type u} [inst : Group α] [inst_1 : Fintype α], IsSimpleGroup α → ∃ (p : ℕ), Fact (Nat.Prime p) ∧ Fintype.card α = p
∀ {G : Type u_1} [inst : Group G] [inst_1 : Fintype G], IsSimpleGroup G → ∃ p : ℕ, Fact (Nat.Prime p) ∧ Fintype.card G = p
